page.title: 02SOCIAL SURVEY-WOOLAVINGTON
page.content: Half of the population have lived in the village for over ten years. There had been some movement into the area during the last year. People had generally come to the village from over fifty miles away. The majority of households had up to three people, one sixth being single. There were children in half of the houses, usually two. Their age varied so some had to travel to comprehensive school. Half of the households had wage earners, mainly working within ten miles. Some were unemployed, a third were retired. Hobbies were popular, gardening and crafts most common. Half the households had pets, usually dogs. A third shopped locally. People also tended to spend free time in the village.
